questions.question: What does a flashing yellow traffic signal mean?
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light indicates that you should slow down and proceed with caution.

questions.question: What does a red arrow signal mean?
options: You can proceed in the direction of the arrow after a complete stop
You must not proceed in the direction of the arrow
You must proceed in the direction of the arrow
You can proceed in the direction of the arrow if the intersection is clear
questions.correctAnswer: You must not proceed in the direction of the arrow
questions.explanation: A red arrow signal means you must not proceed in the direction of the arrow.

questions.question: What does a green arrow signal mean?
options: You can proceed in the direction of the arrow
You cannot proceed in the direction of the arrow
questions.correctAnswer: You can proceed in the direction of the arrow
questions.explanation: A green arrow signal means you can proceed in the direction of the arrow.

questions.question: What does a 'No U-Turn' sign indicate?
options: You must yield before making a U-turn
You must stop before making a U-turn
questions.explanation: A 'No U-Turn' sign indicates that U-turns are not permitted.

questions.question: What does a 'Slippery When Wet' sign indicate?
options: The road is only slippery when it rains
The road may be slippery when it is wet
There is a wet floor ahead
questions.correctAnswer: The road may be slippery when it is wet
questions.explanation: The 'Slippery When Wet' sign indicates that the road may be slippery under wet conditions.

questions.question: What does a 'One Way' sign indicate?
options: You can only drive in one direction on this road
There is only one lane on this road
You can only make one turn on this road
There is only one exit on this road
questions.correctAnswer: You can only drive in one direction on this road
questions.explanation: A 'One Way' sign indicates that traffic is only allowed to move in the direction of the arrow.

questions.question: What does a yellow diamond-shaped sign mean?
questions.explanation: A yellow diamond-shaped sign is used for warnings about road conditions and hazards.

questions.question: What does a rectangular white sign mean?
questions.explanation: A rectangular white sign is used to communicate laws you must obey such as speed limits, turn restrictions, etc.

questions.question: What does a circular sign mean?
options: It is a railroad advance warning sign
questions.correctAnswer: It is a railroad advance warning sign
questions.explanation: A circular sign is used to warn of an upcoming railroad crossing.

questions.question: What does a 'Do Not Pass' sign indicate?
options: You can pass other vehicles only if it is safe
You can pass other vehicles only during daylight hours
questions.explanation: A 'Do Not Pass' sign indicates that you cannot pass other vehicles on that section of road.

questions.question: Who has the right of way at an intersection where two drivers arrive at the same time at a right angle?
options: The driver who is traveling on a bigger road
The driver who is traveling faster
questions.explanation: At intersections where two drivers arrive at the same time at a right angle, the driver on the right has the right of way.

questions.question: Who has the right of way at an intersection with no signs or signals?
options: The driver who is traveling faster
questions.explanation: At an intersection with no signs or signals, the driver on the right has the right of way.

questions.question: Who has the right of way when a vehicle approaches a pedestrian at an intersection with no crosswalks?
questions.explanation: Pedestrians have the right of way at all intersections and driveways.

questions.question: Who has the right of way when two vehicles approach an intersection not controlled by signs/signals, at the same time, on different streets?
options: The vehicle that is moving faster
questions.explanation: The vehicle on the right has the right of way.

questions.question: Who has the right of way in a roundabout?
options: Vehicles with the right blinker on
questions.explanation: Vehicles already in the roundabout have the right of way.

questions.question: What is the speed limit on a highway in Maryland unless otherwise posted?
questions.explanation: Unless otherwise posted, the maximum speed limit is 55 mph on all highways.

questions.question: What is the speed limit in a school zone in Maryland?
questions.explanation: The speed limit in a school zone is 25 mph.

questions.question: What is the speed limit in a residential area in Maryland?
questions.explanation: The speed limit in a residential area is typically 25 mph unless otherwise posted.

questions.question: What is the maximum speed limit on interstate highways in Maryland?
questions.explanation: The maximum speed limit on interstate highways in Maryland is 70 mph.

questions.question: When you park uphill with a curb, which way should your wheels be turned?
questions.explanation: When parking uphill with a curb, the wheels should be turned away from the curb.

questions.question: When you park downhill, which way should your wheels be turned?
questions.explanation: When parking downhill, the wheels should be turned towards the curb.

questions.question: What is the minimum safe following distance under ideal conditions?
questions.explanation: The minimum safe following distance under ideal conditions is 3 seconds.

questions.question: What should you do when driving in fog?
options: Drive with the flow of traffic
questions.explanation: When driving in fog, use your low beam headlights to increase visibility.

questions.question: What should you do when driving in heavy rain or snow?
questions.explanation: In heavy rain or snow, decrease your speed to prevent skidding.

questions.question: What should you do if a tire blows out while you're driving?
questions.explanation: If a tire blows out, you should ease off the gas pedal and keep the vehicle steady until you can safely pull off the road.
